results:
Based on the search results, I found information about the Polish translation of "Jane Eyre" as "Dziwne losy Jane Eyre":

The Polish translation of "Jane Eyre" titled "Dziwne losy Jane Eyre" was translated by Teresa Świderska in 1930. The search results from wolnelektury.pl (Free Books) specifically state that "Bazą naszej publikacji jest polski przekład powieści autorstwa Teresy Świderskiej z 1930 roku" (The basis of our publication is the Polish translation of the novel by Teresa Świderska from 1930).

The novel was originally published in English in October 1847 under the pseudonym Currer Bell, which was Charlotte Brontë's pen name. The Polish title "Dziwne losy Jane Eyre" translates to "The Strange Fates of Jane Eyre" in English.

This appears to be the first Polish translation of the novel, as Teresa Świderska's 1930 translation is referenced as the standard Polish version used in various publications, including the one available on wolnelektury.pl, which is a major Polish digital library for classic literature.
